bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 22, 1897

div1.p: Lazear discusses Sweitzer's upcoming visit to Baltimore.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 22, 1897
div1.p:
I am glad
you have set the day
for coming. Come on
that day by all means.
Mrs. Kincaid did not
come and I hardly
think she will. She
said she would
come on Feb 1. Mabel
wrote to her today
asking her to come
on Thursday of this
week. Mabel got
a bureau for your room
which I think very
beautiful indeed. She
has been haunting the
furniture stores etc
for the last week.
The room looks very
attractive. It has
an open fireplace
you will remember.
I find the flue is
all right and the
heats up very readily with a
little wood.

The Boston concert is on Wednesday
and the programme precisely the same
as for the New York Concert the
next day. I am sorry you cannot
use your ticket in New York.
Mabel has written to Miss
Mary Brown asking her to
use your ticket and to take
dinner with us.

It is too bad you have
not been able to go to the
theatre. There has been nothing
at all here worth going
to since the Damerosch
Opera. It has been raining
a great deal this month so
I hope it will
be better next month.
Today is commemoration
day at the University
but I did not attend
the exercises.

Did you go to see
Mr. Voricke at the
Lorimer? I don't
suppose it would
do any good but there
is a possibily that
some of the things
are still there:

Mabel hasn't the “Makers of Florence”.
She says she read it when
she was in Florence the first
time, and liked it very much.
When is Jane Bowman coming
to Baltimore? We have not
heard from her.

Your fire must have been
exciting. I am glad it was
no worse.
